remarks: Show that the support of a function is contained in a set.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Mar-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 28-May-2019.)
statement:
suppss2.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( A \ W ) ) -> B = Z ) $.
suppss2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
suppss2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( k e. A |-> B ) supp Z ) C_ W ) $.
$d A k $.
$d W k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
